Reviews.Title: Good but not Great
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: Updated on December 16, 2008I upgraded to the Stylus 1010 from the Stylus 830.  Though it is arguable whether it is a true upgrade.Besides the obvious improvements such as the better zoom, higher MP's, and a beefed up lens it is essentially the same camera.  It does have a better battery (up to 70 more shots per charge), simpler controls, and improved software on the camera, but it is not weatherproof, which used to be a standard feature on Stylus models.  Olympus deruggedized the 1010 by taking out the rubber gaskets on the access doors and by replacing the anodized aluminum body that the 830 has with a plastic one.The one major improvement the 1010 has is its ability to accept SD micro cards (with an adapter) which have a considerably larger maximum capacity (up to 16 GB), and are much cheaper than their larger alternative the XD whose capacity is limited to 2GB's (a quick price check on amazon shows that a 4GB Micro SD costs around $6, and a standard 2GB XD card cost around $20.)The SHQ movie feature seems to be a reoccurring problem with Olympus though.  The Stylus 830 was only able to record 20 second clips at VGA 640x480/30fps.  The Stylus 1010 can only record 10 second clips at that setting.  However the 1010 does give you the option of recording VGA 640x480/15fps with longer clips.*A new development on this is a fix from Olympus.  First of all you have to have a camera that currently has the 1.1 version firmware.  If you don't, you'll have to go to their website to update it.  Be aware though, that website carries the following warning."Please note that if the firmware upgrade is not performed properly your camera will need to be serviced to have the camera returned to an operational state."Once you have the 1.1 you will be able to record movies with 4gb and higher SD Micro cards as well as record movies with VGA quality 640 x 480/30 fps up to the full capacity of the card (no longer limited to 10 second)  But this is only with  XD Type M+ cardsor the XD Type H cards. This seems to be a complicated and expensive fix considering the price of buying high speed cards (a 2GB XD Type M+ cost around $30), but it is a fix none the less *Overall I am happy with the purchase and am impressed with the picture quality, and the expanded options in the software.  However Olympus could have spent a little extra time developing a true upgrade for the stylus series instead of throwing in a few improvements, (and retrogrades in my opinion) and calling it two different cameras (the 1010 and 1020 whose only difference is the LCD screen, and flash option on during high speed sequential shooting.)

Reviews.Title: More MP is not always better
Reviews.Author: Heidi
Reviews.Content: I have used Olympus cameras for about 15 years and have always been happy with them. Unfortunately, I have used this camera for six months and am getting a new one. There are several good things about this camera, but there is one huge flaw: poor image quality. I have been doing some research and discovered that the megapixels are the culprit. While the camera has 10MP, the image sensor was not made to accommodate 10MP's worth of detail. Because the image sensor is small, it produces grainy photos. You will get better quality images with a camera that has fewer megapixels and/or a larger image sensor.Some things I DO like about this camera: 1. Good close-up/macro shots; 2. "Scene" settings, such as "Available Light;" 3. Image name includes the date the picture was taken; 4. Portability/size of camera; 5. You can take panoramic photos (if using xD card); 6. Built-in lens cap; 7. Large LCD screen.Some things I DO NOT like about this camera: 1. Grainy pictures, especially indoors; 2. Flash is too bright and frequently washes out my subject; 3. Lens is easily smudged and can be tricky to clean because it is so small; 4. Can't make the image be 4x6 ratio, so I have to manually crop all of my photos before printing them.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: D. Cartwright "diadeloso"
Reviews.Content: Having been a professional photographer and even teaching a couple of college photography classes, I've shied away from anything "automatic"in cameras, and have clung to more old-fashioned methods when taking pictures.I purchased an Olympus Stylus 1010 as a gift for my wife.I'm now stunned and amazed.This camera is virtually foolproof. It simply won't take a picture that's out-of-focus, and worry that the camera might not be steady is no longer a concern. Period.The pictures are crystal clear and I've enlarged them to 16x20 with no loss in quality.My wife even snapped a landscape from inside a car traveling 60 mph, and the resulting shot showed no motion blur at all.I believe.

Reviews.Title: Great Price to Features Value
Reviews.Author: MrTasselhof "Technology Junkie"
Reviews.Content: Pros:7x Optical Zoom, 10MP, 2.7" LCD, MicroSD Compatible, Small Size, Loads of FeaturesCons:Panorama requires Olympus Memory, 10 Second Best Quality Video LimitAftering having this camera for a couple days, I feel confident in its features to write a review.Things I really like about this camera. :*It is the size of my cell phone + a little thickness*10 MegaPixel resolution*An unheard of 7x Optical Zoom for a camera it's size.*The 2.7" LCD is large, bright, and clear even outside*Light weight design even with the battery*Quick 2 hour recharge time on a long lasting batter*I can use cheaper MicroSD memory with the provided adapter.*It is packed with features and shooting modes  ---Auto - Point and Shoot  ---Manual - Adjust Options Freely  ---Scenes - Pre-Selected Modes based on Environment  ---Guided - List that sets camera settings based on what you want to do*2 Continuous Shooting Modes  ---Standard - normal resolution w/ 1 to 2 second delay  ---High Speed - 3 MP resolution w/ very almost no delay*Super Macro Mode - allows the camera to focus on objects less than an inch away*30 minute video clips in the other modesFeatures I am not fond of:*To use the onboard and computer panorama, art, and 3D features you must use an Olympus/Fuji Branded XD memory card  ---The alternative is getting some photo "stitching" software*The highest video quality setting of 640x480 at 30fps allows only 10 second video clips  ---This may be solved by an eventual firmware updateI was able to purchase a 4GB MicroSD memory card for $23 after shipping, compared to $30+ for a 2GB XD card or more for Olympus Brand.  The 4GB works perfectly in the camera and allows for 1600+ pictures on 10 MP Normal quality.  I ran my own test between fine and normal qualities, but did not find enough of a discernable difference to warrant the doubling of the file size.I plan on taking the camera with me on a 2 week cruise in Europe.  I wanted a camera with a great zoom, quality, and the ability to store all of my pictures on a single memory card.  I feel I have found the perfect travel companion in this camera for size, quality, and weatherproofed travel conditions.Overall I think this is a great camera and while I can't use the panorama mode on the camera, I can easily get some "stitching" software to create my own.  I would recommend this camera to those that want a portable large zoom camera with a plethora of features for the basic to intermediate photographer.

Reviews.Title: I do like this camera!
Reviews.Author: Charles W. Long
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am not a great expert.  But I do like to take good pictures, and do have a special need for close-up photos, and both of these needs are accomplished by this camera in a way that exceeds my rather high hopes and expectations.My special 'close-up' application doesn't seem to be covered by other reviewers, and my experience using the Olympus 1010 in this way may be of interest to someone with similar needs. I do scrimshaw wherein images are produced on ivory-like surfaces by an engraving technique known as stippling (creating tones with closely spaced dots). I like to photograph my work in a way that reveals the technique, and shows how images with fine detail are created. In most cases it is necessary to photograph the subject at a distance of about 3 to 4 inches. I could go into much detail about how I struggled to get results approximating what I wanted using other cameras, but with the Olympus 1010 all I need to do is put the subject in reasonably good light and shoot the picture with the camera hand-held in the regular macro mode. The results are so good that I have already consigned my tripods and special lighting platform to the storage shed where they will reside until my next yard sale.For ordinary day-to-day pnotographing I have entertained myself by shooting pictures of various subjects with various lighting conditions, and have been uniformly impressed with the results of my clearly amateurish efforts. There doesn't need to be a book entitled "Photography For Dummies" written for users of this camera. I have proof that it can make one with little photographic talent look very good.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Douglas Haskin
Reviews.Content: I have been using Olympus cameras since the OM-1 SLR many years ago, so I am probably a little biased.I purchased The Olympus Stylus 1010 along with the 2 gig XD card a month ago and have found it to be everything advertized. It is extremely easy to use as a point and show camera though the many possibilities for additional settings may be a little intimidating for a beginner. I had been happy with my previous Stylus except for extreme closeups and telephoto. With the Stylus 1010 the 7X optical zoom takes care of most of my telephoto needs and for closeups using the macro or supermacro settings work just great.Probably the biggest surprise for me was the Panorama feature. This provides the option of guiding you through the necessary steps for three parallel shots and then "stitching" them together right in the camera. This is the feature I show people when I say, "Hey! Look what my new camera will do!"

Reviews.Title: Great Movie camera
Reviews.Author: Tom Hartman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the 7x optical zoom and the image stabilization. I was disappointed when I read other reviews talking about a 10 sec video limit but I need a small point and shoot camera not a video camera so it didn't matter as much to me.  I popped in a 2GB xD card and just to test out everything shot some video to see how it worked.  The camera started to count down from 29 min.  I put it in a tripod duck taped the whole thing to my motorcycle and drove it around my neighborhood it was a short trip but it recorded 6 minutes of really clear video and I was still counting down so I'm sure I could have recorded another 23 more minutes.  It corrected for lighting the sound was good and the picture was excellent.

Reviews.Title: A great camera - with a caveat
Reviews.Author: Moonchilde
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised and delighted with the sharp, clear photos this camera takes, the panorama feature, and the amount of editing that can be done in-camera - it's amazing.  The instructions and the camera's menus are quite friendly if you've ever used a digital camera before.  I'm already using settings that I never could remember how to find in my much less intuitive Sony menu.However, in using all those settings, I discovered that when Olympus and the 1010's users tout the camera's long battery life, they're talking about point and shoot with the occasional flash or zoom, and not taking full advantage of all the special features the camera has to offer.  If, for example, you use the zoom frequently, set your screen brightness to high because you're shooting in bright sunlight, use the Guide frequently, make a lot of in-camera edits, play back to erase old photos you've fixed in camera, etc., a new, fully charged battery drains fast, and without adequate warning.  The battery drain I might have expected, and that's not the real issue for me as I can live with that considering all the great things the camera can do.  The biggest problem for me so far is that after shooting approximately 40-50 photos one day, doing all of the above (zoom, lots of edits, playing back, etc.) the battery indicator still showed green and full.  The following day, after I had taken maybe 5 shots, the battery suddenly (i.e. no quarter or half `down' indications) blinked red and showed a quarter charge left.  At no time when I turned the camera on did the battery indicator show anything but green and a full charge.  After anywhere from one shot taken to 2-3 seconds after turn-on, the indicator showed almost empty, and eventually empty battery.  I had made a trip to a local museum specifically to try the camera out, and left after taking less than half the shots I wanted to try because the battery, which had read fully charged the night before, was completely dead within maybe 18 shots.  Again - it's not the battery drain itself that shocked me (I was doing a lot of experimenting), it was the fact that there was no indication that the battery capacity was being used up, so I could be aware and re-charge before another outing.  After the battery was fully recharged, I did perhaps 5 min or less of editing and deleting on the camera, and when I plugged the camera back into the charger it took another 15-20 mins. to recharge to capacity!  So, don't trust the battery charge indicator, especially if you're taking shots at an event important to you.  An extra battery for this camera isn't just desirable, it's absolutely mandatory to carry with you if you intend to edit in-camera.  If you don't have a spare ready to pop in, you really can't make full use of all of the camera's features, or even most of them, on a consistent basis.  If you're a total point-and-shoot-on-auto user I guess it isn't an issue, but I'm a 'serious for fun' user and I bought the camera for an upgrade specifically to use all its many features.That said, it's a very cool little camera.  I do love the `little' - fits so easily into a purse for take-along all the time.  It's also very light, even with the battery.  In the promo description of this camera, Olympus said that they wanted their color not just to be vivid and bright, but to be `pleasing to the eye', and it's definitely that - much more pleasing and accurate colors than my Sony.  And what's not to like about the zoom?!  Fantastic.  The Shadow Adjustment Technology is brilliant - my favorite feature, really.  It works like a charm.  The macro function works beautifully.  I'm a little confused as to what some of the Scene modes are actually supposed to do.  Shots I took in the museum with the `behind glass' feature actually came out looking worse than without it.  Some of the Available Light shots I took look better than my Sony, some look the same, and some not as good (I was doing retakes of pix I already had from the other camera, under the same lighting conditions, to compare).  The panorama feature is very cool.  As far as the brightness of the screen in bright sunlight - I'd say better than my 2 year old Sony, and viewable in bright sunlight, but just that - viewable, not extra special.  In average sunlight it's definitely better than the Sony.  The video is fine, too - probably as good as the Sony's, and they are known for their video capabilities.  The quick charge works well.In summary, I love the camera and would happily recommend it to others, with a caveat that using all of the features that most people will be buying it for will use up the battery very quickly, so you really do need an extra battery at the least.Update:  Two more weeks of camera use, and I'm a very happy camper.  Absolutely love the panorama (but can someone tell me where to get them printed?) feature, the shadow adjustment, best shot and the macro.  One very nice surprise - I always use Photoshop Express to 'quick fix' my photos before printing or uploading to share, and there is almost no difference between my Before and After results!  With my Sony, there is a pretty significant difference.  How cool is that, when it's almost impossible to improve on the snapped photo?!

Reviews.Title: One star less for the connection cable!
Reviews.Author: Karen F
Reviews.Content: I have had this for about a month but used it on a vacation so it got lots of use.  Lovvvve the color but beyond that it takes great pics.  I am replacing a Canon-S2IS with a 12x zoom (zoom is a major consideration for me in getting a camera).  I was tired of the bulkiness of it and looking for something smaller but with camparable zoom and pic quality.It was between a small camera with a 10x zoom and this camera that caught my eye, I confess, with the color!  The other had higher zoom, larger viewer (another concern for me)but was a bit bigger. the Olympus was smaller but less zoom.  I decided to buy the other when I took one last look through the viewers of both and realized I could see much clearer through the Olympus!  Even without my cheater glasses - even though the screen was smaller! That sold me! I don't miss the difference in the zoom, it takes great pics, flash is great and I haven't begun to try all the easily accessible options for special shots, no flash, etc.  Battery charge lasts a long time.  I got the XDm+ memory card for it so I could take longer videos. Price was $30 for 2 gig, not terrible. The size is great - I carry it everywhere now and get more chances to have some great shots!The one drawback that I stated in the title is the USB connection. I cannot believe that they made it so slightly different that you cannot use a standard PC to camera cable - you need the one they supply. I hadn't tried downloading and I almost didn't take that cable on the trip since I have a standard one I used for everything!  I would have been steaming!  Bad Olympus!

Reviews.Title: 10 second 640X480 Limit fixed
Reviews.Author: Fred R. Suza "fredbillie"
Reviews.Content: This is an update on this subject. The Xd M+ card is now out and with the 1.1 Firmware update from Olympus fixes the 10 second limit for 640X480 video

Reviews.Title: A Great, Full-Featured Point-and-Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph Z.
Reviews.Content: With the Stylus 1010, Olympus has combined a high quality 7X zoom lens with their TruPic III DSLR Image Processor in a well made, stylish point-and-shoot camera.  Since receiving this model as a Father's Day gift I have taken dozens of pictures, and have been greatly impressed with the camera's focusing speed and accuracy, excellent color reproduction, and low noise levels.  Of particular note are the high quality macro and super macro modes which are capable of producing floral photos such as the example that I have posted.  In addition, the Stylus 1010 also offers 23 preprogrammed scene modes, and the Perfect Pix software program which allows the user to perform in-camera red eye and shadow adjustment corrections with the push of a button.  All in all, another excellent product from Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Big Zoom in a small package
Reviews.Author: Long Island MOM
Reviews.Content: I forgot my camera for my son's graduation for college. We had a video camera, but I wanted a point and shoot. I've owned older Stylus models before and never had a complaint, so when I saw this with 10 megapixils and a 7x optical zoom, I knew it was mine.As with any camera you have to discover all the features. One that I loved during the graduation was a continuous shooting mode. I have about 20 or 30 photos of him walking across the stage getting his diploma. With those kind of shots you never seem to time the best shot right, but now you don't have to. You get them all and can pick out the best of the bunch. That mode did use up alot of the battery though.Battery life in general has been great, I don't have to recharge every 2 seconds, and I can pick up my camera after not using it for a couple of weeks and there is still "juice".Overall very happy.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 1010
Reviews.Author: Buffalo MOM "Buffalo MOM"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a few months now and it is fantastic.  I have taken picture in all different lighting situations and have great bright vibrant pictures.  I recently took pictures at my daughters dance recital where you couldn't use a flash and as simple as changing the setting on the camera I was able to take fantastic pictures.  I am very happy with the camera it actually takes better pictures than my much larger SLR camera.

Reviews.Title: great buy, so happy with purchase
Reviews.Author: Jamee Wheeler
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing!  I can take great videos with the XD M+ memory card, the picture quality is outstanding, you just have to make sure you put it in the right mode, you don't even have to open the manual, the camera tells you everything about each mode.  I went on a trip and blew up certain pictures to 8x11 and everyone that comes over thinks they are professional!  This camera is worth the money, if you are looking, you've gotta get it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Diana Ostwald "Snook"
Reviews.Content: This camera works great! I love it. The clearness of the photos are wonderful and the battery life lasts forever.

Reviews.Title: Its just what i wanted
Reviews.Author: Abhishek Tiwari
Reviews.Content: Its just the one which I was looking for. The camera is very sleek as compared to other cams having 7x optical zoom. This is having some cool features like panaromic view. The only cons with this is you need to have Olympus memory card in order to use some of the features including panaromic view. Moreover, i would like to suggest everyone who wants to use this camera for video recording, to buy Olympus M+ xd card for it. The reason is if you buy a normal xd card or M type xd cards you wont be able to record the vedio clips greater than 10 sec.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Art Marko "road worrier"
Reviews.Content: This camera is positively awesome. Many pro-style features in a camera priced at an intermediate level. 7x optical zoom (vs, typical 3 or 5 from most cameras), two types of image stabilization, and, you can preview, on-screen, 4 different exposure settings for the same shot, and pick the one you like before shooting. There's in-camera editing, including cropping, retouching and other functions. There are more preset exposure settings than most people typically use. Create 3-panel wide panoramic shots in-camera, "frame" and add text or make a calendar out of each photo...and you can add 4 seconds of sound to each shot.Even with all these features...you can still set it on Auto...and your Mom, who's VCR is STILL flashing 12:00, can use it and take great shots.Giant lcd screen makes previews easy to see, even in less than stellar situations. I love this camera...and after seeing the results and the rich feature set...three of my friends have already purchased their own. I don't make many purchases without doing my homework...and this one stood out. Check the ratings on [...] where 24 pros and almost 700 typical end-users scored it a 90%, excellent, rating. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Not at all a good camera.(Please do not ignore complaints in other 1 & 2 star reviews)
Reviews.Author: R. Joshi
Reviews.Content: I have an Olympus C 740 and that has 3mp and a 10x optical zoom. It takes much better pictures than the new Olympus 1010 Stylus we recently bought.I don't understand a lot of technical details about cameras but one thing is for sure the pictures are grainy not upto the 10mp standard. I took same pictures with the my older C 740 camera and the new Stylus 1010 camera (with no or medium zoom) and compared them side by side. The pictures from the new camera are very very very grainy.  You will have to be really ignorant to not realize that they are grainy. I am highly disappointed with the positive feedback that people have written. It was very misleading. But the one star and two star reviews are really true reviews. Thank you for those reviews, I should have taken those reviews more seriously. I am returning Stylus 1010 camera. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera.  It takes great pictures!
Reviews.Author: D. Saiz "Deb S"
Reviews.Content: I think that this is a great camera.  I set it to "auto" and let the camera determine if a flash is needed or not.  The camera really does all the work...I just push a button.  I have also used the video option.  I have taken video clips as long as 30 seconds and they come out great and with sound.  I really think that this camera was a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great feature packed camera-compact and easy to use
Reviews.Author: C. Armstrong "Scrapbook Mom"
Reviews.Content: I did a LOT of research before deciding on the Stylus 1010.  I'm so glad I did.  This camera does a fantastic job, and delivers crisp pictures with true to life colors almost every time.  The only problem I had was focusing in low lighting conditions (but I wasn't suprised either time, since the light was so low).  The focusing is quick and there is little lag time between shots.  It's so nice and compact, and the view screen in the back is huge.  I really like the creative features like black and white or sepia choices.  It also has the ability to frame shots, or super impose messages like "Happy Birthday" or "Congratulations."  It's really a great little camera that's fun to use.  I bought the 2 GB card, which was really worth it.  With the 10megabite images, the internal memory gets used up fast.  The card really is a must.  I ended up buying the camera from Amazon, and it was delivered before the anticipated date of delivery.  I also bought accessory packages from Cameta Camera, which was delivered as ordered, and before the anticipated delivery date.  Total buying experience was A+.  Now other members of my family are so impressed with this camera that they're thinking about buying one.  Run, don't walk to buy this camera if you like to take pictures!

Reviews.Title: The Best Point & Shoot Ever
Reviews.Author: nescorp
Reviews.Content: I needed a new point & shoot digital camera since my previous 2MP 3X optical zoom obviously has shortcomings. After days of online research I almost purchased a Canon Powershot. Then I came upon the Stylus 1010. What had me was the 7x optical zoom. But what almost turned me away were reports of 10 seconds cont. video recording time at 640x480 30fps. After further research I purchased the 1010 along with a 2Gb M+ card. Happily when I droped the card in and started recording video at high res. it started counting down from 18 minutes. When I played back the video on my tv the picture and audio quality was great. I did not need to do a firmware upgrade as some said. Once I got to using the friendly controls and the zoom I was awed. People are amazed when I show them pictures of objects with and without zoom. Very impressive for a compact camera.People complain about the panorama mode but there are two in-camera and one pc mode which are very easy to use. Must admit at first I was a bit disappointed with the overall photo quality but that was before I knew how to use features like autofocus and metering. If not sure what settings to use just select 'auto'. Another thing I like is that if you are not sure what a function is for the 'disp' button gives a written explanation. All in all this is a very good camera. Excellent picture quality, excellent zoom and more features than you can get bored with easily. So to all who had doubts like me, once you are going for a compact point and shoot this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Quick snapshots!
Reviews.Author: Dawn Lundeen
Reviews.Content: This camera snaps a picture more quickly than any other I've ever used.  That is important when you have a baby and a puppy to catch looking just right.The screen is large and easy to view.  The 7x zoom is a great feature.  The pictures are gorgeous with the 10 MP.The only negative is that the flash seems to be on the opposite side of the lens of any camera I've used.  This takes getting used to when you want the flash on top when taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA GOOD QUALITY PICTURES
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Rowe "A/V EXPLORER"
Reviews.Content: I DONT UNDERSTAND WHAT ALL THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS ARE ABOUT. SOME PEOPLE ARE COMPLAINING ABOUT GRAINY PICTURES. I AND OTHER PEOPLE WHO USED THIS CAMERA ARE GETTING GREAT CRYSTAL CLEAR PICTURES. I AM ABLE TO BLOW MY PICTURES UP TO 8X10. THIS CAMERA AS ONE GUY PUT IT IS ALMOST FOOLPROOF. SET ON AUTOMATIC IT HAS NEVER TAKEN A BAD PICTURE FOR ME EVER. THE DOUBLE STABILAZATION WORKS VERY WELL. I SHOOT INDOOR AS WELL AS OUTDOOR AND THIS CAMERA DOES NOT TAKE A BAD PICTURE. I THINK THE PEOPLE WHO ARE HAVING TROUBLE WITH PICTURE QUALITY MAY BE NOT USING THE CAMERA CORRECTLY. I HAVE BEEN USEING CAMERAS FOR OVER 30 YEARS. THIS ONE TAKES AS GOOD A PICTURE AS MY PENTAX K1000 35mm. I LIKE THE 7X ZOOM, I LIKE THE SIZE OF THIS CAMERA, AND I ALSO LOVE THE 10mp. I AM USING 2GB xd CARD, BATTERY LIFE IS GOOD EASY TO USE, GREAT CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing camera
Reviews.Author: T. Corson
Reviews.Content: For a long time I looked forward to owning a Stylus 1010.  I'm sorry to say that I'm sadly disappointed.  There are so many good reviews that I thought it was a sure thing.  I wanted it mainly because it's small enough to fit in a purse and it's the only pocket camera I could find with a decent zoom (7x optical, equivalent to 37-260mm).  Unfortunately, every time I have the lens completely extended I get a blurry picture.I also get many grainy photos.  In all but the most ideal light situations the pictures are grainy or blurry.  Sometimes in full sunlight they are overexposed.  This is mainly with it on automatic settings.  I have played around with some of the multitude of other settings but have not been any more impressed.  Sometimes supermacro will give you a cool shot that is clear but just as often it will give you a blurry shot.  If your subject is moving at all with the macro settings then don't even waste time trying.  That is pretty much true with every other setting except sports.  And, I don't mean moving fast, I mean moving even slightly.This was supposed to be an easy point and shoot camera that my fiance could also use but it's obvious that he will not be able to count on getting a good shot with it.  Sometimes I think that my expectations were too high because I normally use a (semi) professional camera (Nikon D70S) but I do think a pocket camera should take at least 70% of the "normal" or "easy" pictures clearly.  I've owned a pocket size Canon camera before and got much better results.  The Olympus Stylus 1010 is a sad disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: madisontom "Madisontom"
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this for teens.  Perfect size, great zoom, everything I could want in a camera.

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: Lacey Donatelli
Reviews.Content: I got this camera and 1 week later exchanged it for a new one because every picture was blurry. The new one worked for about 5 months until the flash stopped working. It either never went off or would go off and the entire picture was bright white. I tried every setting and finally went out and bought a Kodak. Huge waste of money.

Reviews.Title: omg
Reviews.Author: J. Bailey
Reviews.Content: OMG!i purchased this camera in march 2009 grand presentation on HSN in purple. got it for 149 on 5 flex pays. lOVE IT, USE IT EVERY WEEKEND!all the different setting are great. I really like the " behing the glass" modes for places like the zoo.  My package came with a case, charger, battery, USB cords again all for $149. anyway im still excited about this camera. NO problems just be sure to check the setting for auto shut off/ power save. its worth the money but i know my cheap self would not buy it regular priced. its really difficult to buy electronics online but the presentation was wonderful. check out the presentation on HSN site, it was really detailed and they went over every feature

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: supercsi4
Reviews.Content: I finally decided to upgrade from my Kodak camera which was over 6 years old and stopped holding a charge.  I needed something with lots more zoom and something more compact because my last camera I used more for traveling and now I needed one for nights out with friends and something I could just throw in my purse and take around with me.  I am a long time Kodak lover, but this Olympus had me hooked with all its zoom and better yet came in a pretty purple.  Great camera, great price, just what I was looking for.  Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: An Outstanding Inexpensive Camera
Reviews.Author: Cameron MacDonald
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife so she could carry it in her purse, instead of slinging her SLR around her neck. This camera has so many features that it is amazing. Beautiful pictures, clear, no shake, lighting is great, incredible boot time, practically instant. Panoramic stitching in the camera, video, rapid shoot. If you miss a shot with this one, you were asleep. I'm buying a red one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Get a Canon, not this
Reviews.Author: W. Archer
Reviews.Content: I bought the Stylus 1020 (same as the 1010 but with a better display screen) but quickly regretted it. This camera has a 10 megapixel image, but even when shots are saved at the "FINE" setting, the image quality is noticeably poorer than a 4-year-old Canon Powershot 6-megapixel camera. Comparing images from this and the Canon side by side, it's obvious that the Canon images are crisp and clear, while it looks like the Olympus images are shot through gauze or fog.Yes, I did check to make sure the lens was unobstructed.... No luck there; it was clean as a whistle. I'm turning right around and taking this camera back. Please don't disappoint yourself. Get a Canon (or anything else that has better picture quality).

Reviews.Title: Great fast camera
Reviews.Author: Linda Welch
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  I purchased several and had to return them due to slow shutter speed.  This one is pretty fast.  The purple color is a little more hot pink than purple, but is pretty.  The screen is large.  The camera fits well in your hand and is very easy to hold and use.  Great settings too, with descriptions of what each setting does and means.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: One awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: I will add my voice to the many positive reviews of this little gem and comment upon some of the negatives expressed elsewhere.First of all, I must give a standing ovation, two thumbs-up, and any other accolades you can think of, to my absolute, positive favorite feature of this camera:  MACRO MODE, and, even better, SUPER-MACRO-MODE!!!!  Macro mode lets you focus on a subject down to four inches from the lens, and still allows use of telephoto; super-macro-mode lets you focus down to TWO CENTIMETERS (less than 1 inch) from the lens.  I do a lot of EBay and have need for detailed closeups of hallmarks and faded writing on antiques, and this feature is UN-BE-LIEVABLE.  Not only can you get 1 inch from your subject, but with 10 megapixels of resolution, you can go into Photoshop, crop a small section of the resulting picture, and blow it up to many times its size while still maintaining good clarity.  The result is that you can obtain clear pictures of details that are FREAKING MICROSCOPIC.  I kid thee not.  This feature alone is worth the very reasonable price.  You will find one or two reviews that comment on some kind of "focusing problem" when in macro mode.  To those people, I say:  RTFM!!!  When you hold the shutter part way down, the camera displays a focusing square, and it will be green when the camera successfully focuses.  It blinks red if the camera fails to achieve focus.  If that little guy is green, you will get a perfect picture every time. If it's red, just move a bit farther away from the subject and try again.  When you are operating that close, half an inch one way or the other makes a huge difference.  I will repeat:  THERE IS NO FOCUSING ISSUE IN MACRO MODE!!!!!OK, enough of that.  Other items:1) Some of the negative reviews say the picture quality is poor.  Those people must have been reviewing a different camera.  Or else they were competitors trying to badmouth the product.  Picture quality is superb.2) Many reviews comment that "shadow mode" is the key to taking good pix with this camera.  YES IT IS!  They goofed a teeny bit by not making it "on" by default.3) Yes, the 7x optical zoom is sweet.4) BATTERY:  One review commented that the "battery remaining" display is inaccurate.  I have to concur with that.  It tends to say 4 bars for a long time and then suddenly drop down to zilch.  However, in general the battery life is good and par for the course as such cameras go.  One review commented that if you use a lot of the optional features of the camera, the battery runs out quickly.  I'm sure she's right, but that is true of ANY camera.5) Personally I like to play around with settings when I shoot pictures and prefer cameras that are less "point'n'click" and more "do-it-yourself".  This camera has achieved a good balance between the two.  The automatic features of this camera result in good enough pictures that I really don't have much desire to play around (although I do recommend that you read the manual to learn more about how they work and become fluent with them).  They do allow you to perform a fair number of manual tweaks if you care to (but not aperature and shutter speed, the two most important ones!).6) Some reviews have commented that the flash is too strong.  I rarely use the flash and this thing takes great pictures without it 95% of the time (and it has several special modes to help you avoid using the flash). However, the one or two times I've tried, the results were less than stellar.  Yes, it seems on the strong side and seems to wash out the colors somewhat.  I'm convinced there's something I can set on this camera to improve this situation, but I haven't taken the time to figure that one out.Bottom line:  I LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!  And it doesn't even cost an arm and a leg.  The camera I truly thought I wanted was the Canon Powershot SX10, but I just couldn't bring myself to shell out the $400.  I decided to give this one a try and am very glad I did.

Reviews.Title: Love it, small size, good picture quality
Reviews.Author: R. Perez "Great Watcher"
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on vacation to Costa Rica, zoom worked great.  It was my backup camera to my 20x zoom.  This one was great becasue I was able to put it in my pocket and go.  I've blown up a couple pictures to 8x10 portraits and they look really good.  All of my pictures were taken during day time!  I had a little trouble with pictures in low light, but I didn;t really play with the features, so its probably just me.Really like the small size of it and the zoom capabilities.  well worth it!

Reviews.Title: Searched for a long time & settled with this one
Reviews.Author: taneaone
Reviews.Content: I researched for a couple months on finding a new camera for myself. I stuck with this one due to the zoom capacity, the many functions and the reviews were fairly better than the other ones I looked at. I am not, by far, an expert photographer but I know what I like and how I want my pictures to come out.This camera is really easy to use and figure out. On the down side, I was also looking for compact, and I got it. Sometimes it is difficult to hold and take pictures. MAKE sure you keep that wrist band on. The functions are great. I also use the micro function when doing really close up pictures for my ebay store (The Bargain Barrel) and it comes out crystal clear. It took me awhile to figure that one out!!Overall I am really pleased with my purchase and pictures!!

Reviews.Title: Avoid this model!
Reviews.Author: Old Drums
Reviews.Content: I have owned a 1010 for over three months, and I am very disappointed with it. The images are consistently flat, lacking in color, and usually blurry. The flash mode is never remembered, so it usually flashes outdoors when you don't want it to, and sometimes with a force (fill) flash set to on, it won't flash. During videorecording, the sound is flawed by loud scratchy noise at the start of each recording.

Reviews.Title: Buy Something Else...
Reviews.Author: Nadia Bracken
Reviews.Content: I had an old bulky Stylus zoom camera for years.  It did not fit in my pocket, only took expensive XD cards, and was slow.  However the picture quality was amazing and I constantly received compliments on my gorgeous photos.  It was effortless and I was so happy until one day the zoom lens froze halfway out.  I had taken nearly 10000 photos and had beaten this camera up so I decided to upgrade rather than have it serviced.The Olympus 1010 is not an upgrade!  The pics are nowhere near as nice as my old Olympus.  Way to cheap out on your product Olympus - what a complete disappointment.  I couldn't return it without a restocking fee so I just sucked it up and decided to do better research next time (Circuit City).  Ironically, this camera broke within one week - the zoom lens got stuck halfway out.  I had to pay to ship it to Olympus to have it repaired. It cost about $20 and I was furious.I've taken about 4000 photos and luckily it has not broken again but I am always worried.  I like the size of the camera, panoramic feature, image stabilizer, and the macro is nice.  It takes great outdoor shots and I like the options in the menu and scene guide (I do not find the menus intuitive however). I use a tiny pocket tripod and the timer function to take amazing macros and night shots.Indoor picture quality is severely lacking. Photos are always grainy or blurry.  It is just not an easy point and shoot camera. I have learned to only extend the zoom around halfway - 7X pics are garbage because of the poor quality.  They look fab in the LCD and then when I look at them full size I am disgusted by the blurriness.  The battery lasts for a full day of shooting (extend the life by using the built in power save feature which turns off the LCD between shots) but I don't know why they bother to give you an indicator.  The thing stays green and full until it goes to empty and red and then the camera dies after about 10 shots - wow, thanks for the head's up that I might want to charge my battery. You are not able to zoom during movie mode.If you do buy this camera, get an extra battery, a case, a mini-tripod, and be prepared to only enjoy your night, macro, and outdoor shots.  Having read the reviews I might buy a mini SD card, too.  If I had my $250 back I would do more research and buy something else.

Reviews.Title: No complaints at all
Reviews.Author: S. P. Cole
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as something simple and easy to keep in my bag for everyday pictures of my kids.  I have a degree in photography, and was hesitant to purchase a point & shoot camera- but lugging an SLR all over is just not practical with small children.  The quality is good, it is very user friendly, and the options are great.  I will continue to use my SLR or my medium format camera when I want to do fine art photography- but for everyday use, which is what I wanted this camera for, I couldn't have picked a better product.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Malcolm Birch "RB"
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Panorama stitching a little off, but may be the operator. Love the zoom and image stabilization.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Jordan Derbas
Reviews.Content: This camera is very small, and takes nice pictures.  You can't beat the price for 10 megapixels, and definately not for the 7x optical zoom.  There are settings gallore, some that are actually very useful.  One useful one is document mode where you can take a picture of a page up close, then be able to pull it up on your computer and have the text be pefectly legible.  Overall, highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: A useful small camera
Reviews.Author: Joe D "RealGuns.Com"
Reviews.Content: I use an FX format SLR and film cameras for more formal photography, so the Stylus 1010 was purchased for general family snapshot use. As an upgrade to older model Oylympus S350 and Canon S400 models, the S1010 represents a substantial improvement. The lens quality and focal length range is much more useful, pulling in far subjects with longer telephoto function and covering wider landscape and rooms with wide angle coverage. Flash output is higher, so there is much less light fall off when taking indoor shots. Both shadow and highlight range have improved with far greater detail.Long delays between shots are gone, continous shooting is 4x faster and transfer of files to a PC is similarly improved. The view finder is bright and viewable in sunlight, controls are handy. The steady shot function is very effective in controlling camera shake in low light. 4GB of storage and long battery life are convenient.Software features to me are gimicks that have little practical purpose and quickly lose their entertainment, need to fiddle, value. I can turn a camera on its end to change from landscape to portrait and I can pretty much tell when people are smiling. "Gimick" of course does not include improved exposure and contrast control with useful metering options that are included in the product.The camera will not deliver high end SLR results, as it does not have the optical range or image sensor coverage and density to do so. But as a point and shoot casual camera that can handle a lot of use, it's a very good product.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Waylon Foster
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade for me from another Olympus product. It is a wonderful little camera. Pictures are clear and crisp and the zoom is great. The only thing I can think to mention that may bother some people is that when you are filming videos, you can't toggle the zoom while the camera is running. You need to set the zoom where you want it and then start filming. I bought the 1010 kit and the microSDHC card allows you to film 30 minutes of video at a time (with lots of room left over on the card). An empty microSDHC card will allow for 1500 pictures. Great Buy!

Reviews.Title: So Far, So Good!
Reviews.Author: KDubs
Reviews.Content: So I bought this camera about a month ago, because I was looking for a replacement for my Stylus 310 (It seems so long ago...).  I had read all the reviews, both positive and negative, and was - to be honest - a bit hesitant to invest.  However, I've come to trust Olympus, and I know that often, a poor review can stem from limited knowledge of how to make the most out of a product.Needless to say, I gave in, shelled out the $250, signed up for Amazon Prime (yes, the trial saved me about $11 in expedited shipping charges), and next thing I know:  shiny new (silver) toy!The camera is great.  I've taken some really amazing super-macro photos (I call them my "study" on texture), the battery lasts seemingly forever, the optical zoom is impeccable, and I had no problem taking lengthy videos with a non-Olympus card, and the Shoot and Select modes have proven to be a veritable party starter.I think this camera has reinstilled my passion for on-the-spot photo taking and seeing the world through a very large, bright, and clear lcd viewfinder.  I say go for it!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: CJ in NJ
Reviews.Content: Olympus Stylus 1010 10.1MP Digital Camera with 7x Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom (Blue)Olympus Stylus 1010 10MP Digital Camera with 7x Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)This is my second digital.  My Canon Sureshot broke.  A good excuse to get a camera with more optical zoom.  This camera is compact, has great features, and is realtively easy to use for a novice like me.  There are many different modes to choose from if you don't want to use the auto.  I bought the Olympus memory card and have plenty of video time.  Some other reviews reported this to be a problem.  The clarity and color of the pictures are very good.  The LCD screen is very sharp.  It's small and easily fits in a pocket.  The only down side is that there is no view finder for outside.  I only found this to be a problem in very bright sun.  Enjoy the camera.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 1010 Camera
Reviews.Author: C. McGuire
Reviews.Content: I diligently searched for a good quality point & shoot camera that was easy to use & small in size. I used the product reviews by Amazon & other camera sites.  I recently used the camera for a Mediterranean cruise & absolutely loved the ease of use of the camera & picture quality.  It's easy enough for an amateur to use & has other features that I'm looking forward to learning how to use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: R. Stokes
Reviews.Content: I can't find anything wrong with this camera. Both zoom and clarity outperform my friends new Nikon digital 35mm slr. That was a shock to me and him. Long battery life, very bright display, unbelievable video. Also, it is superior at low light settings, even with the flash off. Just put the dial on SCN and find the 'available light' setting. It comes out brighter than it appears to your eyes. Also very easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Magnificent camera
Reviews.Author: Miguel Artiles
Reviews.Content: Previously I used a digital camera Sony, but this is very superior in quality. I am very content with it even continuous discovering new possibilities. The photos that I have done are fantastic and in spite of the great amount of possibilities that it gives you, it is relatively easy its use.I like to make photos of the nature, of landscapes and with this camera whose zoom lens is fantastic I can easily manage to photograph with great quality which I wish.

Reviews.Title: excellent pix and usability
Reviews.Author: jlh
Reviews.Content: Sooo easy to take pix in any situation. Take a video as long as you want. From closeups of flowers to sunsets - I love this camera. My friends ask to see my camera so they can check out what I've shot lately because I carry it with me everywhere.  The large screen is great...and you can see it in full sun. No complaints about this litte gem.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a present for my birthday and it is wonderful. I am taking the best pictures I have ever taken so far. I shake like a leaf and even some of the best camera can't compensate for that. This camera kept my pictures stable even if I am not. That is what was the most important to me I don't care how great the camera is supposed to be if all the pictures end up fuzzy it isn't worth it. This camera was worth every penny to me. Also if you have children this would be great. My son never stops moving which would normally make for a bad picture but this camera adjusts even when he is running the picture turns out clear. It is also very easy to use I figure out even the fanciest of feature in just a few minutes with the camera. I would recommend it to anyone on the go that wants great pictures.

Reviews.Title: This is a GREAT little camera
Reviews.Author: Frank Dometrovich
Reviews.Content: My wife and I could not be more pleased with this camera!Great Pix, lots of useful features, easy to see display - even in the bright sun!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase
Reviews.Author: Kristal Barnes "Kristal"
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Olympus 840 and returned due to poor quality photos . . . ordered the 1010 because I still believed in the Olympus brand.  This camera is FANTASTIC!  Great, high quality photos . . . !!!!Glad I made this purchase . . .

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 1010 Camera
Reviews.Author: WolfPup
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift, because I already have an Olympus camera. The display screen is big and clear and takes wonderful pictures. Pretty easy to use, even right out of the box. I would recommend this camera for anyone who likes a little bit of color (I purchased a purple one!) and a whole lotta fun!!

Reviews.Title: BEST CAMERA EVER
Reviews.Author: Joshua Cox
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever used.  It takes excellent photo. Very easy to use. Crystal clear LCD screen.  And has just about ever photo modes I will ever us.  I was really surprised.  I took several photos at night (in night mode)(great pics).  I also to some pics of pool water. some in auto mode and the in the beach mode. Huge difference.  The colors and shadows. The camera also has a close up mode.  I thought I would never use it.  Until I went to the beach 2 weeks ago.  I found so crabs so i tried it perfect, you could see ever little detail.  I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Pictures come out one of two ways - grainy or blurry
Reviews.Author: J. Kurus "Janice"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 7 months now.  Occasionally, I'll get nice crisp, clear pictures, but most of the time they come out either blurry or grainy.  I thought it was me, so I kept trying to change how I take pictures.  I previously had an Olympus which took beautiful pictures.  Now, after reading the other reviews, I've realized it's not necessarily my fault that the pictures are coming out so bad.  I believe I got buyer protection on this camera, and I will be taking it back.

Reviews.Title: Yuck - buyer beware
Reviews.Author: TwinMama
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the 7x zoom and maybe I got a lemon - but I was so disappointed.  Most of my photos ended up grainy.  Both inside - outside and especially using the zoom - I was never really able to zoom in and get it to be in focus.  And not being able to zoom in and out in videos was so annoying.  I know other people swear by this camera but I say "buyer beware" - there are better camera's out there.  My earlier Canon Powershot digital elph's totally out performed this camera in quality and crispness of photos.  One good thing about this camera was the battery life - it did seem to last forever.  But I really hated it and was actually happy when it croaked last month (got wet) and so I just purchased the Panansonic Lumix TZ5 with a 10x zoom - and absolutely LOVE it - it actually focus's when using the 10x optical zoom and even the 16x digital zoom has better quality photos than I ever got on the olympus!  Pictures are crisp and clear and it doesn't have a lag in shutter response so I am actually able to get the cute photos of my kids I want - not them turning away!  I would recommend it over Olympus anyday....

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 1010
Reviews.Author: tommytough "tommytough"
Reviews.Content: Great camera full of features. Works flawlessly. A must have. Great size fits in your front pocket. Beach Camera shipped quickly. Everything came together as promised.

Reviews.Title: Pretty terrific except for....
Reviews.Author: L. H. Oakes
Reviews.Content: I have had an Olympus for about 4 years and wanted a small one so I could use the same XD card, and also not have so much weight in my purse.I also wanted a larger viewing screen.  I love the size and the screen.BUT when I was looking at the specs I neglected to notice it does not have a viewfinder and so in bright sunlight it is not very good seeing what you are trying to shoot.  I am an artist, so that matters a LOT to me as I take a lot of shots for painting references.  The other thing that isn't good is that the built-in flash doesn't reach very far at all. My older camera has a pop-up flash that does a much better job.But now I know all this and can make adjustments.  I still am using my older camera, and if I need to shoot indoors with flash, I will take it instead of my new attractive PURPLE camera!  It has a great optical zoom at 7X which is better for me when outdoors shooting stuff at a distance.  My old one is a 5X optical zoom.  I'm not sorry I got it, but these two things are issues to consider.

Reviews.Title: Look Elsewhere - Wish I Had
Reviews.Author: Western Girl "bookgirl"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace another Olympus in fall 2008.  I've hated it ever since.  It takes one good picture for every ten fuzzy pictures - not good when you're trying to capture something fast or when you get home and look at it on the computer and realize you didn't get anything.  While it is nice it has the adapter to take the microSD cards - some of the camera features don't work with it (like the panoramic feature).  Every single time I use it, I state at least once that I HATE it.  Can't think of one thing it has taken a consistent picture of if you take more than one.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money...
Reviews.Author: KJ
Reviews.Content: I have used Olympus cameras my whole life and have not had the issues that I have with this camera. After one year it went freaky - making the pictures over saturated with red & purple lines after a few seconds of being on. I now have to send it to their repair center for evaluation. It better not cost me a penny, since it seems to be an issue with the picture program function in the camera.Olympus always made quality products, but lately it seems they are dropping the quality ball. It seems they are trying to add to many frills without the quality to back it up.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing
Reviews.Author: dnd517 "Diane"
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera. It was the first we could find with a 10X zoom, which we needed for sports shots. Unfortunately pictures come out extremely blurry when the zoom is used to the fullest. When flash is used, pictures become washed out. When flash is turned off, pictures are dark. I also tend to use the record feature but recorded images are choppy, not a smooth stream that I want in a video. Battery life is good but that is the only good thing about this camera. I actually went back to my old Canon Powershot Elph.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic all-in-one camera, Lots of features & settings for any kind of photo
Reviews.Author: beckster943
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year ago to replace a Kodak Z730.  In a word, I LOVE this camera!  Some of my favorite features:* It has a big LCD display, visible even in bright sunlight.  The one thing missing is a window you need to squint and look through, but to me this is nothing.  I prefer not having that window.* The high optical zoom of 7x is great for zooming and maintaining picture quality (fyi, digital zoom is useless - the optical zoom is what lets you zoom in without getting pixelatged pictures)* 10 megapixels mean you can enlarge to 8"x10" or more and your photos still maintain their quality without getting pixelated or faded.  This actually ended up saving us hundreds of dollars; we unfortunately had a home improvement contractor try to screw us over, but we were able to use our photos to prove against what he was trying to do (long story!) so this camera has already paid for itself!* There are presets you can use - select "behind glass" or "extreme close up" or any of a dozen other presets, and you can point and click instead of needing to know what f-setting or macro mode will yield the best photos.* The battery life has been great - I think I can take at least 200 photos, with flash, and with using the photo review, without needing to recharge.* The video quality is terrific, including picture and sound.  The sound review is a little quiet, but download it onto a computer and you can hear everything just fine.* The camera has software to download photos to your computer.  The software works, but I prefer saving photos to my memory card and just using a memory card reader.The price on this camera is just about right +/- $200.

Reviews.Title: Much better out there for the price
Reviews.Author: BikerChick
Reviews.Content: Wanted to upgrade from my trusty digital Cannon because we wanted a larger viewing screen and a slimmer, smaller camera. That is about all we got with this purchase.The photos are usually grainy indoors on any setting, be it auto or not. The stabalization feature really has never lived up to the claims made by Olympus. Many of the photos we have taken have enough blur in any motion situation to make them unacceptable. Outdoor scenic shots with no motion aren't bad, but that is about all it can do well. The preprogrammed settings for action shots, night photos, etc. actually produce worse results than just leaving it on auto.TWO DAYS after the one year warranty was up the camera just stopped working in the middle of a series of still photos I was trying to take- black screen, funny noises, etc.The customer service was terrible. They insisted it was due to 'impact' and said it would be $105 to repair. They were cold, rude and hade a huge "take it or leave it" attitude. There was no impact to this camera - period. I really thought long and hard about spending that kind of money on a camera I wasn't real happy with in the first place. Replacing this sub-par camera with a better one would have cost more than I was able to spend at the time.My husband needed a camera for work, and he took our older Cannon when we purchased this. I'm trading him - he can use this crummy camera for work and I will go back to my bulkier, but way better, Cannon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot value.
Reviews.Author: foxglove
Reviews.Content: I have limited experience with digital cameras and purchased this one for a vacation.  I have been so pleased with the features, ease of use and quality of the pictures taken with this camera. Small, lightweight with a large digital display.  The battery has long life and I purchased a second for my trip. Also, it is easy to order the photo card online, it was difficult to find one locally at a reasonable price. For novices, like me, I suggest you read the instruction manual and practice using different features of any camera prior to an important event. I couldn't be happier with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Product
Reviews.Author: Bashar Makhay
Reviews.Content: Well i was excited to get this camera, when i got it, it took pretty good pics, nice zoom, it was pretty decent.Problems i had were that it did not do goood in low light, and autofocus wasnt great.  The battery cover latch broke, and the spinwheel was fading awayI sent for warranty, they fixed the spin wheel and battery cover latch.  Unfortunately they did not comepletely fix the autofocus, it did ok in light, just not dark, i didnt have time to send the item back for a couple months, then when i did they claimed i "impacted" it.  There was NO impact to this camera, warranty refused to fix it, and now i have a half ass camera.Ridiculous.Never again olympus... Canon all the way.

Reviews.Title: Top notch easy camera, only one drawback
Reviews.Author: T. Yarbrough "Vtwin"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  I travel a lot, and it is great to have a camera that can always fit in a pocket and draws fast.  In Short:Pros:- Great picture quality.  Lots of preset options for taking pictures in specific situations, such as low light, against glass, sunset, etc- Fast draw.  From pressing ON to being able to shoot is about 2 seconds.- Good sound quality on video.  I've used this to record live music, and it while it's not a studio, it's clear and has a good frequency response range and is sensitive even at a distance- Zoom is powerful and clear.Cons- zoom isn't adjustable once video starts.  It is a good enough video that I'd like to use it as a staple video camera, but the lack of zoom limits the usefulness

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Zurek
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money.  We use these for business and I just bought 3 more.  Easy to use and good picture quality.  Can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money.
Reviews.Author: S. Simon "S.S."
Reviews.Content: We were seeking a camera for family photos that was relatively inexpensive, light weight and had some zoom capability. This camera really fills the bill. It was easy to set up and get started. Excellent value for the money. Only minor gripe is a minor delay between photos taken repetitively. We are not finicky about the quality of photos and are strict amateurs. Therefore, this camera is more than adequate. Highly recommend it (bought a 2nd one as a gift already).

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: T. Hagan
Reviews.Content: My wife just loves this camera.  This is the second one I bought for her after I broke the first one by dropping it on the floor.  You can adjust the quality of pictures you take by using up to 10 megapixels.  The clarity is really good at 10 mp, but the space fills up fast.  We generally use 3 mp, which is great for everyday use. The video feature is really cool too.

Reviews.Title: Not Impressed
Reviews.Author: Tennis Girl
Reviews.Content: In the new year I decided to update my camera and buy a new digital. I chose the Olympus Stylus 1010 for several reasons including mp's and video; however, when I got using it I found it to be somewhat complicated to use and not user friendly. I recently took a trip to Italy in which I was hoping to get some great pics unfortunately, despite my careful handling, it just stopped working- black screen, strange noises etc. Needless to say I was extremely upset seeing as I had probably only used it MAYBE 5 times and only had it for about 6 months. Since this time I have been in a battle to get it repaired and when I finally did get it repaired it came back from the authorised repair corp in damaged condition forcing me to return it again and try to explain the current defect. In conclusion, though I have little money to spend, I have even less patience at this point and will probably just take my licks and get a new one. I would say don't bother with the Olympus. In addition to making a sketchy product their "customer service" department is not up to par and their aithorised repair place even less so.Sorry to be so harsh, but this is what happened.The End.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: Brett Walker
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about 10 months. Have used it for various family events (3 kids), skiing, fishing, mtn biking and other outdoor uses. This camera has been fantastic when we use it outdoors, but when used indoors the pics look grainy.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful and easy
Reviews.Author: H. Harris
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a little more than a year.  I took it to Disney World and got some amazing pictures.  I am no pro but some of them would make great postcards.  It is easy to use and small enough to go in a pocket.  My niece got one after me and she loves hers.  She travels to other countries a lot and also has amazing pictures.  Highly recommend to anyone wanting easy.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: T. Mack
Reviews.Content: Olympus Stylus 1010 10MP Digital Camera with 7x Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)This camera is amazing! It takes great pics. You have to play around with it to learn and take advantage of all the features. I also learned a few things just reading through all the reviews......my favorite tip so far is to turn on the Shadow Adjustment Technology when the camera is in shooting mode. (This is the same button that you erase pics from when you are viewing them.) What a huge difference in the clarity of pictures you get just using this one little feature. I leave it on all the time. Don't worry about accidently erasing pics because you have to actually be in view mode to do this and it asks you if you are sure before you actually erase anything. What a great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Olympus!
Reviews.Author: Theresa F. Gallegos Rivera "theresa gallegos"
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Olympus camera and i love it. my old one broke and im glad i chose this Olympus Stylus 1010, I'm normall not good with electronics but its easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: I received my camera in two days.  I have had it for over a month and can't believe the sharp pictures it takes.  It is small enough to fit in my pocket and has a large viewing screen.  Very easy to use also.

Reviews.Title: Nice.
Reviews.Author: N. Truckenbrod
Reviews.Content: Overall great camera so far, no complaints.  Taking video at highest quality is no problem even with the cheap 4gb sd micro card I have, the firmware update fixed the problem with only being able to take 10 sec of video on those cards. A lot of people have said that without the flash the pictures are blurry, which I did see at first.  But if you use the 'available light' setting, the pictures come out clear as day.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Compact
Reviews.Author: Windsor
Reviews.Content: Very useful camera and compact. Upgraded from a 5MP 3X zoom to this camera, no comparison. So far the pictures have turned out really good. Also the video quality is great. Although i'm not sure if the item was new, looked new but the box was not sealed.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Desert Rat
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Olympus camera. I started out with a film version and have purhcased Olympus every since. I purchased this camera for use with my consulting business. This camera is fantastic; easy to use and durable. The pictures are very clear and the grid helps me to center the pictures. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone that needs a good point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: it was better than I thought
Reviews.Author: Z. Wang
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few weeks ago.  Before I bought it, I read many reviews.  I was concerned about some of the negative reviews. However, I was relieved after I got it.  It turned out much better than I thought.  If you have time to play with it, it has amazing functions for such a small camera at this price.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality!!
Reviews.Author: Janc
Reviews.Content: This camera was a steal....  I decided what camera I wanted based on the features, and then checked around for the best price, and the Amazon price was about 40% cheaper than any of the stores in my area.Picture quality is fantastic and I like the small footprint.  It is easy to handle and relatively easy to use for point and click photos. But you can also play with the settings if you want to take even better pictures.The only think I don't like is the battery.  It is expensive and you really have to have a second one charged and ready to swap into the camera.  The other option is to take the card out of the camera and charge it when not in use, etc.Otherwise... it is a GREAT deal on a fantastic camera.  Not the top of the line by any means, but well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 1010 110MP Digital Camera 7X
Reviews.Author: James Washam "james"
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera. Easy to operate; long lasting battery; 7X Zoom take Great pictures!2 GB SD card lets me take hundreds of sharp & clear pictures

Reviews.Title: Great camera with great price
Reviews.Author: H. YU
Reviews.Content: The picture is better than we thought before we bought it. Especially we like that it works well in dark indoor environment. It is also easy to navigate through the functions and review the picture.Besides, the battery life is actually better than described. We had no problem taking over two hundred pictures (I think it will have no problem taking three hundred pictures) with constant checking the pictures and using flash light.

Reviews.Title: Olympus 1010 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Susan A. Knight
Reviews.Content: I am extremely satisfied with the recent purchase of an Olympus 1010 digital camera.  It is easy to use and takes very clear pictures.  It is light weight and is easy to put in a pocketbook.  The zoom is wonderful.  I would recommend this to anyone that needs a digital camera and enjoys the "zoom" feature.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: pd
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Olympus Stylus (710 lasted several years and several continents but eventually died; 840 I had less than a year before I dropped it) so I obviously like the product. Compact, well designed and well built, 7x zoom and 10.1 MP is hard to beat for the money. Can be used as a simple point & shoot but has lots of options too if you care to get into them. Wish this series were still weather resistant. I've heard good things about Canons too.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: R. Kin "bunbun321"
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera.  If I search really hard my only complaint would be that the video doesn't zoom.  But I don't know if any camera does that.I DO recommend buying this camera from AMAZON.COM. It is MUCH cheaper than best buy or ciruit city.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera.
Reviews.Author: E. Ertel "trailtrekker"
Reviews.Content: Just what I was searching for - light, easy to use, great close-up and distance pictures.

Reviews.Title: Really worth the price
Reviews.Author: Yousef
Reviews.Content: Nice, beautiful look. It's cheaper to buy online then at stores. Has many features that are so easy to use, there is no need for a manual. Supports only XD and Micro SD, though it's better to buy the micro SD card from amazon. Takes nice clear pictures and automatically focuses on the item you want to take a picture of. Just give it 2 seconds to focus and out comes a clear picture. The macro feature is amazingly clear and High Def. I never wanted to spend more than 200 on a digital camera, but this is worth more than 200.

Reviews.Title: Greatest Camera so far
Reviews.Author: Nick Zeragia
Reviews.Content: had this camera for 1 week an i love it, had nikon coolpix s550 be4 which was great but this is even so much better. shutter speed, picture and camera quality itself is amazing

Reviews.Title: olympus stylus 1010
Reviews.Author: jodean
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use. The pictures are clear.  My hands shake quite a bit and the stabalization feature is great.  The only thing is you need to let people know you have to buy optional equipment to use underwater.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: G. Leymon "Greg"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price.  Make sure to purchase the recomended memory card and you will be very pleased.  Very fast downloads, crisp vivid pictures.  Very easy to use with a sleek, attractive look.

Reviews.Title: Better than I thought could  be possible
Reviews.Author: Tim Dwyer
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for the better zoom and rechargable battery. Awsome performance best zoom I have ever had. Can take almost 100 pictures on a single charge thats even with using the flash. Get features and tutorials to help you use the camera to its peak performance. If your looking for a great camera with many features and compact to boot dont pass this one up.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera but miss the date stamp
Reviews.Author: Future Technologies "TK"
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera based on its small size, high megapixel, and high zoom capabilities but will be returning it due to the missing and very important date stamp. I am using the camera to take pictures of my growing child, and need to be able to look back and know the precise date the picture was taken. Otherwise, I LOVE this camera, it takes nice, clear pictures, is easy to use (once I read the manual cover to cover), was reasonably priced, is cute, fits nicely in my purse for those spontaneous hilarious moments kids seem to have, and perhaps most importantly, has an almost zero delay in taking the picture once you press the shutter button. (This last point was the reason I decided to upgrade from a Kodak EasyShare.)All in all, I am VERY, VERY disappointed in Olympus' decision not to provide date (and less important to me, time) stamps with its cameras. It pains me to return this camera, but the stamp is just that important to me.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Fuller
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. My previous digital camera was an Olympus but much bigger. This one fits in my pocket. It also takes pictures fast so allowing you to catch the moment and with grandkids that is great. I really recommend this camera and Amazon is the cheapest place to get it.

Reviews.Title: 10 second HD video limit
Reviews.Author: Lee Martin
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice camera with lots of features, however, I would caution anyone looking at it to note that it is limited to only 10 seconds (yes, ten seconds) of video at high resolution.  I called Olympus, and they said it is an issue with their memory card and could not say if the problem would ever be fixed.

Reviews.Title: 7*zoom, dual stabilization, wide angle
Reviews.Author: J. Larsen
Reviews.Content: great camera - really happy with it. Easy to operate, got the features I was looking for: large zoom, "wide angle" via in camera stitching, dual stabilization, high mega pixels, pocket size, good price, good quality, nice design.

Reviews.Title: Falls apart after a few months. Stay AWAY
Reviews.Author: L. Nast "Tinker"
Reviews.Content: I usually try out a few cameras before settling on a new one every 2 or 3 years.  This camera seemed great during it's trial week, but since owning it has fallen apart.The screen mars easily.  The buttons are printed with ink that wears off.  The chrome decoration on the top tore off.  The camera now turns on and only shoots in Vivid purple tones 50% of  the time.  The docking cable has a propietary connection that is unnecessary. The battery inidicator is very inaccurate, showing full charge until you have about 10 shots left. This is after 6 months of mild usage!!I have always loved my Canons and Lumixs.  DON"T BUY THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Stylus 1010 has no movie Zoom!
Reviews.Author: scottls1 "scottls1"
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews that concurred!Oh, for a GOOD "waterproof" compact digital camera!???I returned itModel Number: Stylus 1010"I can not believe that I can not use the zoom while video function, when even with my very cheap old camera I could. I returned it. Overall I'm very disappointed with Olympus, the 3d model I return. The picture quality is grainy.  I would need to get a extra video camera if I want to video my kid... It didn't help at all that after calling Olympus they told me it has a zoom while using video, so I re ordered this one. What a waste of my time.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with this camera
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: I am a newbie to the camera world, and my camera needs are quite simple. I wanted a simple no frills camera to take pictures.Pros:- Takes quick pictures. This camera does not take forever like some others do. This was a key feature for me as I have a newborn and its easy to miss out on key moments due to waiting for the picture during, and that nasty delay after you take a picture that prevents you from taking another.- The interface is very non-cumbersome. I am non-techie when it comes to cameras. This camera fits the point and shoot type of mentality. I also like the interface for the setting that asks you what type of picture you are taking so that it can adjust the flash (it asks portrait, water pictures, night pictures etc...)- The charger is very non-bulky. Lots of camera come with chargers that have long cables and just cause clutter. This one is a little box that plugs into your outlet and the battery goes inside the box. Nice, simple and clean.
