Battery life is quite reasonable.- Turns on and is ready to fire very quickly (at least versus other cameras I have used).Cons:- A little pricey for a simple camera, other simple cameras are less expensive. However, I was willing to pay more because this camera takes quick pictures and this was a critical feature for me.- I have noticed some noise on the pictures. I should point out that this could be user error as I am just using the default settings. The noise is very small and I really only notice it when using my huge 25.5 inch monitor (that has a decent color and resolution display). On my 22inch monitor (that is of lesser image quality) you cant really see the noise. I personally don't have a problem with the noise because I was willing to accept some picture noise for quick performance. I did want to mention this flaw as I realize there are people out there who maybe more anal then myself about the quality of the picture. If I had to put a number on it I would say the picture quality (on default setting) is 7/10. I also noticed that many of my pictures came out with Red Eye - but it was easy to fix with Vista's default picture viewer which can fix this with a couple of clicks (again not a issue for me personally but I did want mention it.So far I am very pleased and I would recommend it, esp if quick pictures is important to you (assuming you don't mind paying a little more).Side note: I noticed the camera came with some software to edit pictures, I have not installed the software so I cannot comment on that.

Reviews.Title: Fastest Power-On to Shoot!
Reviews.Author: A. Fair
Reviews.Content: A great little pocket camera, with an incredibly fast power-up time to take a picture. Lots of great "shooting modes" and a nice in-camera panorama feature (xD card only) made it great for my last trip. The 7X optical zoom was perfect for some long-distance shots, but even the image stabilization can't keep those perfect. Great display and battery life (I won't miss exchanging the AA batteries like my old model). A 2GB xD Card is good for storing a lot of pics, especially if you don't need to shoot above 5MP (and who really does?)Very nice! These little cameras are getting better all the time, but sadly, still lack the speed and picture quality of a full-sized SLR.

Reviews.Title: Olympus 1010 camera
Reviews.Author: Quicken User
Reviews.Content: This camera fills all our needs. We particullary like its small size and it is amazing how much technology is packed into its small frame!

Reviews.Title: 6 years later, I still use and love this camera!
Reviews.Author: WalksDogsHerdsCats "Cb"
Reviews.Content: Functional, sturdy, versatile, logical, this camera has been my constant companion since I bought it. The flash card had to be bought separately, and it fit in the case of my last camera, as I would not recommend not having a case. The battery still recharges, but is discharging a little quicker now.

Reviews.Title: This camera does it all.......
Reviews.Author: Ellin
Reviews.Content: This camera has so many really cool settings, plus it can go underwater...and yes I took it snorkeling many times...the pictures come out great, and it's resistant to breaking if dropped.

Reviews.Title: Not that great
Reviews.Author: Bob Andrews
Reviews.Content: Doesn't take standard cards - a pain as most computers won't take Olympus cards!  Takes good pictures and handles well.

Reviews.Title: still a great camera after 5 years
Reviews.Author: val55
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since summer of 2008 and I haven't found the "perfect" camera to replace it yet.  I have thousands of great photos and have enlarged them up to 8 x 10 and they still look great.  I have many photos from our European trips that are beautiful.  For people that have fuzzy images, try the "Sport" mode - I've taken photos while riding on boats and in cars that are still clear - and videos, too.  The macro and super macro modes do a good job......you can see the fine hairs of bees and the stamens with pollen on flowers.  One does have to know how to focus if need be - you always should press the photo button half-way down - you will hear a beep - and if it looks good, continue pressing the button the rest of the way - if not good, start over and press halfway again.  This becomes automatic after you get used to it.  This is true for any point and shoot camera and I think is a primary reason most people get irritated at the out of focus results when they don't do this.  Another point I would like to make is that even professionals delete half their shots due to quality - don't be afraid to take multiple shots of the same subject to get what you want and try different settings.

Reviews.Title: My best transaction
Reviews.Author: thomas glynn
Reviews.Content: I usually don't review products but the camera I bought was priced lower than any other same model I have purchased, arrived very quickly, was in new condition with (free unexpected/gift) accessories likely valued at more than the total cost of the purchase. I think I have been most pleased of any Amazon purchase with this transaction and seller. – Similar products from other vendors have arrived with false claims of product quality and accessories that do not show up with the shipment at double the price. – Many thanks

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use but white balance inferior
Reviews.Author: reader "Cole"
Reviews.Content: Pro's-easy to change settings and very intuitive to navigate with shortcut buttons to change between macro and regular or adjust exposureCons-does not have manual white balance and auto doesn't work very well so most photos need to be color corrected, ring around lens comes off easily and while it does not effect use, it is helpful protecting the lens

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 1010 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: fab24
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera to throw in your purse or pocket-- the quality of the pictures is excellent and since its so portable you will never miss a shot. It's a great when I don't want to lug around my full size SLR. Plus love the fun colors!

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: KayTLyn
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for almost 3 years now and I still love it! Its only been dropped once (not my be unfortunately) so I cant say exactly durable it is.  BUT I went from an old Nikon to the Olympus and Oh My Gosh what a difference in the quality! Now, I'm not a professional photographer, so I don't know where the quality rates, but I have had photography students ask about my camera because the quality is that good.  Yes, yes, there are a few times where the pictures have come out grainy, but I'm sure if I knew exactly the mode to use, they would have been fine.  The only problem I find with this camera is that it doesn't do night scenes well.  You basically have to have it on a tripod in order for it to take a clear picture.  The reason why I didn't give it 4 stars for this is because I feel that every camera does this.  All in all, if you are a joe shmo looking for a camera that takes very good quality pictures, this camera is worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money (unless you buy a good warranty plan)
Reviews.Author: hfh484
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for about 3 years.  I had to send it in for repairs after about 9 months when my friend dropped it.  After charging me over $90 to fix it, they sent it back, and it worked almost as well as it did before *Bob* dropped it.  Sometimes, however, the camera wouldn't turn unless I pushed the power button two or three times.  Sometimes the image on the screen would be nothing but a fuzzy blob.  I lived with this issues for a while because they would resolve themselves after a couple of tries.  Finally, the camera quit working all together.  I tried to take a picture in the macro setting and when I tried to turn the camera off, it made a sickening whirring sound and the lens refused to retract.Other than those issues, the camera has served me well.  I have taken it to 3 countries and gotten great pictures.  I am moving to Asia soon, though, and I want to be sure my camera will work the whole time I am there.  Olympus just hasn't shown it can do that for me.

Reviews.Title: Most trusty little digital cam I ever had.
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and despite having a nicer SLR, I love portability. If I can fit it into a clutch handbag, it's my new best friend. I've been through a lot of these little digitals, most of them HP which I would NEVER recommend. This camera has truly been the most portable. It's stood up to all the bumps of getting out of taxis, being stuffed under the seat on planes, being turned on and off over and over because I keep seeing something else I love while on the road. Also you won't find these features with most digital cameras of the same cost. I can do a panorama, combined in camera, in 15 seconds and it looks beautiful. Image stabilization is a dream. The super-macro setting looks professional.

Reviews.Title: A to Z guarantee worked great
Reviews.Author: Alexander McLean
Reviews.Content: This used camera from an Amazon partner came broken. It did not say that when I ordered it. The seller did not respond when I contacted them, but Amazon returned my money through the A to Z guarantee program. If it hadn't been for that I would have been out for the purchase price of $35.

Reviews.Title: A great little point and shoot, very good macro
Reviews.Author: Kest Schwartzman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take product shots for my website. I make jewelry, so having a very close focusing macro was one of the highest things on my list of necessaries. Olympus POS are the kings of that, and this no exception- it focuses as close as one inch from the subject, making it possible to take a detail shot of part of a ring. The white balance could be better, and i often end up correcting it slightly in photoshop, but no big deal.For less specialized needs, I've taken the little guy on vacation, as well, and he's preformed mightily for a tiny camera. A few summers ago we were going into the Amazon for a week, no electricity- I did get one spare battery, and a four gig card. We filled the card before running out of batteries, which I'll take as a win on battery life. The zoom is impressive, the video records sound ( great for "you won't believe the sounds those monkeys made!" moments), and the camera easily fits in the pocket of a pair of jeans.

Reviews.Title: Olympus 1010
Reviews.Author: Noel Kuck
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a replacement for an identical one that had been stolen, which I really enjoyed. It has all of the features for a nice portable camera. I like the "scene" setting that makes selecting a quick set-up fast and easy.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Kidd "LivLyfe515"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera back in the spring of 2008, we have had a blast with it ever since! It takes wonderful pictures even on "Auto" mode and it is very easy to use all the different mode options. It even takes great pictures in the dark on the available light mode, inside & outside. We use this mainly for family events and outdoor trips. I don't have one complaint about this camera, it has everything we need and more.

Reviews.Title: Great Price Great Camera
Reviews.Author: E. Sullivan "iggychase"
Reviews.Content: Versatile and light weight, great camera for the amateur. Battery life is phenomenal on a single charge - don't miss carrying a bag of AA spares with em. Camera fits in pocket, easy to use, and great results.

Reviews.Title: Great Valentines Day gift
Reviews.Author: Anthony Borisow
Reviews.Content: My fiancee was upset when the digital camera I gave her a few years ago gave out.  With my cousin's recommendation I picked up this camera.  Easy to use, good price for the features, good picture quality.  The lady likes it so it gets the 5 stars from me :-)

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 1010 Review
Reviews.Author: Melvin Inatsuka
Reviews.Content: Recently, I had out-of-state guests at two different times and had used the Olympus Stylus 1010 camera on both occassions. So far, it's been great to me. I haven't used the video feature yet except when I've accidently used it on a self-timer. It was hilarous when we've viewed it later... However, it seemed to come out nicely. In the past, I had Olympus Stylus 710 and that camera was great! I gave it to my fiancee and she loves the camera too. That is why I decided to buy another Olympus digital camera. I'm a great fan of Olympus!

Reviews.Title: Great Acquisition
Reviews.Author: Wilma Montalvo "Diane"
Reviews.Content: Excellent acquisition.  The value and the resolution was so great.  The pictures are really clear and colorfull but the zoom is +AA.  Much better than the Cyber Shot and the other ones.

Reviews.Title: Nice out door camera but!
Reviews.Author: John A. Croney
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice camera. It's small and neat and easy to use. It is up and ready to take a photo in seconds, which is one thing that I wanted in a camera and ready to take another photo if you miss the first shot. But the images just do not cut it for indoor usage. Outdoors they look very good and clean but indoors they get very grainy. They look good on the LCD before and after, but once you take them off you see the true quality.If they just fix that problem this would stand on top all the rest.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 1010 10.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: K. Jenkins
Reviews.Content: I love the camera but it is not the easiest to use. I still need to figure out the red eye thing.

Reviews.Title: Big Produxt in a small package
Reviews.Author: Lorrilyn J. Bove
Reviews.Content: I picked this camera out for my birthday. It is wonderful! The pictures are clear and sharp,no matter how much they are enlarged.  The 7x zoom allowed me to take great videos from 20 rows up at a recent sporting event.  I wish the sound was a little louder, but when you download to a computer, it is easily adjusted.  The scene selector is fantastic, just select what you want to photograph, push OK, and click! I would highly recommend this camera to anyone who wants a small compact camera loaded with features.  Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: B. Woolf
Reviews.Content: This is my third digital camera dating back to 2001 and this is by far my favorite.  The size is perfect for traveling and having around the house for those moments when you just want to snap a shot.  The screen on the back is terrific and easy to see in almost all shooting conditions.  The available light setting lets you go flash free in almost any conditions.  Easy to use.  Light.  Great value.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera, Great Price on Amazon!
Reviews.Author: America's Second Harvest "Developer"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good pictures.  I have not yet found a camera that takes flawless pictures upon movement of people.  It is a very nice size and of course, the purple color is great!  The clarity is good.  The user friendliness of the software for editing is about a 7 on a 1-10 scale.  Good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: J. Fortune
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect. This is my first digital camera purchase and I love it. I did alot of research before I bought and it paid off. I take alot of pictures and children it's always in my diaper bag. Takes awsome pics. The battery life is excellent. The color purple is cool too. I would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: easy to use, fine clear pictures.
Reviews.Author: Napoleon
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use, the pictures are clear ,but there isno camera eyepiece visor for acurate shots, only the LCD screenwhich can be a drawback with a strong light.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 1010, disappointing
Reviews.Author: Julie M. Manzi
Reviews.Content: I researched point and shoot cameras for a few months, and finally decided to go with the Olympus Stylus 1010 seeing that I liked my mom's older Olympus and have had trouble with Canon cameras taking washed out pictures or breaking.  The best part of this camera is the crop feature, and that's about it.  The pictures look awesome on the lcd, but when they print, they look flat and the color is way off, especially the color purple.  When you take a picture of purple, it comes out blue!!!  I thought with technology new cameras would be better, but with this Olympus, the older Olympus digital cameras are better.  I am sending this one back, and either getting another Canon, or a Sony Cybershot.

Reviews.Title: pretty decent camera : )
Reviews.Author: Helen "lotsofkids12345"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this one month ago to replace my canon sd200 of 3.2mps/ 3x zoom. I wanted the 7x zoom in a small point & shoot. When comparing, I prefered the color saturation (white balance) better in my Canon! I still like my little canon and think it takes some better shots! I took a lot of side by side shots and was even considering returning this new one! However this Olympus can do amazing things...the technology has come a long way. I do love the panoromic stitch mode, in camera editing, etc...however, I was VERY disapointed when I used the continuous shooting mode with the zoom. My pics were automatically shot in a lower resolution and they came out quite pixelated. (it was an important event)Overall, now that I have had time to really play with the camera and work with the modes, I actually find it is a decent and fun camera for most people to enjoy. It does most of the thinking FOR you if you want it too! It is a lot of camera for a small price. I still don't always like the color tones vs my canon...but that's just my personal take.UPDATE: now 2 months later.....I am using and loving my camera more...I have finally downgraded and given my beloved Canon to one of my older children. I did find a feature that was very helpful that I use quite often which helps with the color saturation! I turn on the "SHADOW ADJUST" little button on the lower bottom right (shared with the erase button) and that brightens up my pictures and makes me much happier! I wish I did that from the begining....so simple...and it really makes a difference!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: Jaimie Hall "Author of  Support Your RV LIfes...
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my Olympus Stylus 1010. My husband has a Nikon D70 which takes excellent photos. I use the Olympus for shots for my blog RV Home Yet? and online articles and for sending to family and friends. It is small and easy to carry yet takes excellent photos.

Reviews.Title: Great quality camera
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before I bought this camera on Amazon and I love it.  It is simple to use, haven't quite learned the more advanced settings but to turn on and just shoot is super easy.  Good quality images and quality material it is made out of.  I bought it in purple and love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Keep Looking
Reviews.Author: T. Bowman
Reviews.Content: This is one of those times when I assumed the obvious and was wrong. Who knew that Olympus had decided that no one needed a date & time stamp on their photos... I use the camera for work related inspection photos and need that feature. A friend cautioned me to look at Canon before I bought but I didn't listen. Now the wife gets a barely used Stylus 1010 and I get to spend more money on a Canon SD880.

Reviews.Title: Not up to olympus standards; poor customer service
Reviews.Author: D. Kolody "Lady Doctor"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in January 2009 to replace a Stylus 710 that I had dropped.  It never worked properly.  It didn't focus at all on telephoto settings.  The second time I used the camera, the lens would not retract.  I sent it in for repair.  Olympus claimed the camera had been dropped, and, so was out of warranty.  Offered me a new cameral in exchange for both the 1010 and 710, along with $100.  I said, "no thanks; it was a brand new camera.  Repair it".  I took it with me on vacation in June.  Telephoto focus still didn't work, but, I thought I wasn't using it properly.  Tried again on vacation last week. Telephoto still not functioning.  I intend to send it back to Olympus complaining that camera doesn't appear to have been repaired, as the auto focus still doesn't work on telephoto settings.  I don't intend to pay them any more money; I could buy a brand new camera for what I have already paid on repairs for this nearly new, used only 4 times, camera.Incidentally, the Stylus 710 works fine.

Reviews.Title: Expensive Lesson Learned
Reviews.Author: S. Hamer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an upgrade to my ageing Canon Powershot A75. I have used olympus cameras in the past without issue, borrowed from friends. However, this camera takes terrible pictures, no matter how I played around with the scene modes or putting it on auto.I admit I'm no great photographer, but I've taken literally 1000s of photos with my old camera and they look great - but I struggle to get 1 in 10 looking nice on the Olympus. Everything looks grainy, blurry or the wrong colour - even in daylight.Unfortunately, the online store where I purchased the camera does not refund on poor choice, so I have lost all the money I spent, including on 2 olympus branded mem cards and batteries.All I can say is this is definitely not a point and shoot - you have to be willing to play around with the settings like a pro, but even then there is no guarantee you will get a decent shot. Sometimes your shot will look great on the LCD, and then transferred to the PC, it looks terrible, no matter what resolution you choose.Glad I bought it well before I needed it for my honeymoon, as I'm pretty upset at the waste of money, but at least I have time to get something else.

Reviews.Title: Its ok but i expected better.
Reviews.Author: LinaLeese
Reviews.Content: Hi, After reading all the reviews, I decided to give this camera a try.  Its a very beautiful cam. I love the color and all the features on it. My only little problem is that  the shutter is so hard to press down. By the time it actually flashes, the "moment" for the picture has passed.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Hicks
Reviews.Content: This camera is the bomb!!!  It takes awesome quality pictures.  It is very easy to use.  It is also very small for the amount of features it has.  I absolutely love it@@

Reviews.Title: Olympus Camera
Reviews.Author: Tito "Red Sox"
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, does more that I could have expected.  Impluse buy beacuse of high pixel count, glad I made the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 1010
Reviews.Author: CJ "Mominator"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this handy little camera. Easy to use and small enough to keep in my purse for those unexpected snapshots. Lots of nice features and you really don't need the manual to get to know them. Fun, Fun, Fun...

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: J. A. Glogouski
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a few weeks(I bought it on my daughter's recommendation-she has one). It takes very good pictures & is pretty easy to use, even for someone like me, who is not a great photographer. No complaints, so far...

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 1010 Digital camera
Reviews.Author: James Brossard "jimbrossard.com"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera! I feel it is the best value for the money period!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Lee A. Hill
Reviews.Content: Great camera for anyone who wants a little more than the basic point and shoot camera. Haven't played with it enough to be too specific, but to date have found that the super macro settings are amazing, have gotten terrific closeups of flowers, etc. Not so sure about low lighting, but haven't experimented much. Digital zoom also seems to be very good. Would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Stylus 1010
Reviews.Author: Kent & Laura's Mom
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. With a 2GB memory card you can take over 400 pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin Curley
Reviews.Content: Camera is great, would order again. Takes great pictures and has a ton of features.

Reviews.Title: I hate this camera
Reviews.Author: AHD
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a Casio Exilim that kept breaking.  I had heard good things about Olympus, but this camera has been a complete disappointment.  I am an amateur photographer, but I know how to use point and shoot cameras.  This camera is the least user friendly piece of equipment I own.  It takes unfocused pictures, the zoom is sub-par, and the settings are confusing.  For the life of me I can't figure out how to change from color to black/white.  There are so many better cameras out there for the price that I paid (around $250).  I would stay stick with Exilim -- it takes the best pics I've seen in a camera that size and it's super easy to use.  For a little more money and a little bigger camera, go with the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ28.  The picture quality is AMAZING.  It's what I'll be buying as soon as I finish writing this post!I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: NOT AVAILABLE AFTER ORDER WAS CONFIRMED
Reviews.Author: Nancy Kirby
Reviews.Content: I ordered this product and the order was confirmed with a shipping date given. When I did not receive the product by the expected date, I called the company and was told the camera was out of stock and they would not be able to get any more. They did refund the money but I had to order a different camera elsewhere and did not have a camera in time for photos of my grandson's birthday.

Reviews.Title: Camera review
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Eisenberg "watchman"
Reviews.Content: Good camera, not a great camera. It will suffice for everyday pictures, but if you want something unusual or technical, it does not cut it.

Reviews.Title: Excelente CAMARA!!!!
Reviews.Author: M. Portillo
Reviews.Content: Esta camara es muy buena.Se puede lograr con ella muy buenas fotos. Es compacta, ligera y bonita.Buen zoom, buena resolución..La recomiendo 100%

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, Excellent price
Reviews.Author: Debbi
Reviews.Content: The stylus is a bit larger than we had wanted but the combination of 10 MP and 7x zoom was too good to resist. We have had 4 previous Olympus digital cameras and have liked them all. This one is small enough to fit in many shirt pockets, or a purse. Image stabilization helps overall picture quality. The batteries are very small and light, and hold a charge for a lot of pictures. Uses the same XD cards as previous cameras.The back display is large and easy to use, as are the camera controls. Very easy, for instance, to change from auto flash to fill flash while your subjects are still smiling. We bought this for our first European trip and we are very happy with it. Should be a 5 star rating, must have goofed when I wrote the review.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: O. Nedkov
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the previous poster. This camera is horrible!I thought it was defective and exchanged it, but the new one was just as horrible. So, buy it if you don't care about the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: camera  needs to be recalled
Reviews.Author: go
Reviews.Content: this camera made mess with my pictures. it is no good in a low lite room,i am very upset with the way my pictures came out.olympus should recall it. i have a old stylus 8.0 it takes much better pictures.
